je.util

Class Turtle

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Canvas
        • je.util.Turtle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Turtle
extends java.awt.Canvas
    This class is a turtle component for simple graphic programming.
    Version:
    3.03 20/03/2012
    Author:
    Gerhard RÃ¶hner

    • Field Detail

      • turtleX

        public double turtleX
        turtleX is the x-coordinate of the turtle

        Example: 

        myTurtle.turtleX = 100;

      • turtleY

        public double turtleY
        turtleY is the y-coordinate of the turtle.

        Example: 

        myTurtle.turtleY = 200;

      • turtleW

        public double turtleW
        turtleW is the current angle of the turtle in the range form 0 to 360 degrees.

        Example: 

        myTurtle.turtleW = 180;

      • originX

        public double originX
        originX is the x-position of the cartesian coodinate system within the turtle canvas.

        Example: 

        myTurtle.originX = 0;

      • originY

        public double originY
        originY is the y-position of the cartesian coodinate system within the turtle canvas.

        Example: 

        myTurtle.originY = 100;

      • drawDynamic

        public boolean drawDynamic
        If drawDynamic is true you can watch the drawing of the turtle.

        Example: 

        myTurtle.drawDynamic = true;

      • sleepTime

        public int sleepTime
        For drawDynamic = true you set the delay in milliseconds for drawing.

        Example: 

        myTurtle.sleepTime = 500;

    • Constructor Detail

      • Turtle

        public Turtle()
        Creates a Turtle with a canvas. At the beginning the Turtle is placed in the middle of it's canvas. The start angle is 0 degree, which means the Turtle looks to the right. The background color is white, the drawing color black.

        The turtle position can easily be changed by clicking into the canvas.

        The size of the canvas can easily be changed with the mouse.

        Example: 

        Turtle myTurtle = new Turtle();

        Sets turtleX to x.

        Example:

        public void setTurtleY(double y)
        Sets turtleY to y.

        Example: 

        myTurtle.setTurtleY(-30);

      • setTurtleW

        public void setTurtleW(double w)
        Sets turtleW to w.

        Example: 

        myTurtle.setTurtleW(270);

        public void setDrawDynamic(boolean b)
        Sets DrawDynamic to b.

        Example:

      • setSleepTime

        public void setSleepTime(int s)
        Sets SleepTime to s.

        Example: 

        myTurtle.setSleepTime(100);

      • turn

        public void turn(double angle)
        Turns the angle of the turtle relativ by the parameter angle. Positive values means a turn right, negative a turn left.

        Example: 

        myTurtle.turn(-90);

      • turnto

        public void turnto(double angle)
        Sets the angle of the turtle absolute by the parameter angle. The angle increases counterclockwise, therefore right = 0, top = 90, left = 180, bottom = 270.

        Example: 

        myTurtle.turnto(270);

      • draw

        public void draw(double length)
        The Turtle draws a line of the length specified in the current direction.

        Example: 

        myTurtle.draw(100);

      • drawto

        public void drawto(double x,
                   double y)
        The Turtle draws a line form the current position (turtleX, turtleY) to the position (x, y) relativ to the cartesian coordinate system.

        Example: 

        myTurtle.drawto(200, 300);

      • move

        public void move(double length)
        The Turtle moves without drawing the length specified in the current direction.

        Example: 

        myTurtle.move(100);

      • moveto

        public void moveto(double x,
                   double y)
        The Turtle moves without drawing to position (x, y) relativ to the cartesian coordinate system.

        Example: 

        myTurtle.moveto(100, 200);

      • setOrigin

        public void setOrigin(double x,
                      double y)
        Sets the origin of the cartesian coordinate system within the turtle's canvas.

        Example: 

        myTurtle.setOrigin(100, 200);

      • setForeground

        public void setForeground(java.awt.Color c)
        Sets the drawing color of the Turtle to color c.

        Example: 

        myTurtle.setForeground(Color.red);
